brief_summary.textblock:
Finnish Genetic Study for Arrhythmic Events (FinGesture is a prospective case-control study
      assessing the characteristics and genetic background of consecutive series of  autopsy
      verified  out-of-hospital victims of SCD vs. survivors of an acute coronary event in a
      specific geographical area in northern Finland.

clinical_study.brief_title: Finnish Genetic Study for Arrhythmic Events

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Sudden cardiac death verified by medicolegal autopsy (cases)

          -  Acute coronary event (increased troponin levels/ECG markers of ischemia/angina
             pectoris; two out of three criteria) (controls).

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Sudden death due to other causes (cases).

          -  Acute coronary event patients who died during hospitalization (controls).

study_pop.textblock:
Consecutive victims of sudden cardiac death verified by medicolegal autopsy (cases).

        Acute coronary event patients admitted to the Oulu University Hospital who survived to be
        discharged from the hospital (controls).

clinical_study.official_title: Finnish Genetic Study for Arrhythmic Events

oversight_info.authority: Finland: The National Advisory Board on Social Welfare and Health Care Ethics

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
